checklistDescription: Items for all new TTS employees.

gsaOrientation.description: Remember to bring two forms of ID and your I-9 form.

walkToTTS.description: Your buddy will welcome you to TTS.

logOnMac.displayName: Log onto your Mac and change your account password

changeENT.description: This is your password for signing into systems administered by GSA, including your email, calendar, and Google Drive. You'll receive instructions via email.

setUp2FA.description: Note: You must set up two-factor authentication inside a federal building. Instructions are sent via email and here.

setUpSlack.description: Slack is our chat program. Follow the setup instructions and make sure two-factor authentication is activated.

setUpGitHub.description: Follow the Github setup instructions to make sure you have full access to GitHub. #adminds-github can assist if you've made all updates and still don't have access.

addContactInformation.displayName: Add yourself to the 18F Staff Contact Directory

startOrientationClasses.description: You will begin taking a variety of Slack-based classes in #18f-classes. See the class schedule and Google Calendar for details.

secureLaptop.description: Review instructions then download Managed Software Center and ClamXav.

checkCalendars.displayName: Make sure you can access 18F Calendars

checkEmail.displayName: Double check access to 18F team email
checkEmail.description: Check your inbox for a note from 18f-team@gsa.gov. If not, head to #talent to make sure you've been added to our team email account.

checkTTSEmail.displayName: Double check access to TTS team email
checkTTSEmail.description: Check your inbox for a note from tts@gsa.gov. If not, head to #talent to make sure you've been added to our team email account.

readOfficeGuide.description: Get to know your office. (There's one for distributed teams, too.)

attendAllHands.description: The all-hands meeting takes place at 12:30pm ET every Tuesday.  Qituwra Anderson will add you to the calendar invite.

transitSubsidy.description: If you take public transit, fill out this form to receive your subsidy.

avatarSelection.displayName: Change your Slack and Google avatars
avatarSelection.description: Add a photo to your Slack and Google avatars. Instructions: Slack and Google

setupPhone2FA.displayName: Set up 2FA on your government phone
setupPhone2FA.description: After receiving your work phone, set up two-factor authentication.

pickUpBadge.description: Your badge should be ready on your first day. If not, please make sure you get it at some point in your first week.

setUpVPN.description: This will allow you to access GSA sites from outside the network.

listservsSignUp.description: A full list of newsletters and listservs is here.

meetDirector.description: They'll likely schedule a first meeting during your first week.

fillOutForm.description: You'll need to turn in an OGE-450 form. You can ask questions in the #oge-450 slack channel.

virtualTea.description: Get to know your teammates over video chat. You can use Acano, Google Hangouts, or Appear.in.

readOrgChart.description: Learn about 18F's organizational structure and relationship to TTS.

confirmCHRIS.description: Your CHRIS account lets you access your personnel file. This may take 4-6 weeks. Instructions

signIntoEmployeeExpress.description: This is available after your first paycheck. You will receive an invite email from GSA HR. Instructions

confirmOLU.displayName: Confirm your OLU account and take classes
confirmOLU.description: OLU is where you’ll take mandatory training for GSA employees. This will be available after your CHRIS account is set up.

confirmBenefits.description: Make sure your <a href="https://handbook.18f.gov/benefits">benefits<a/> are set up correctly.

fillOutIDP.description: Instructions. This will allow you to take external trainings and classes.

addToTrello.description: Ask #admins-trello to add you to the 18F Trello board.
